1 min read Generated February 01, 2026

Markdown Basics

Learn the fundamentals of Markdown syntax.

Text Formatting

Basic text formatting options:

  • Bold text using **bold**
  • Italic text using *italic*
  • ~~Strikethrough~~ using ~~strikethrough~~
  • Inline code using backticks

Headings

Use hash symbols for headings:

# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3

Lists

Unordered Lists

- Item one
- Item two
- Item three

Ordered Lists

1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item

Code Blocks

Use triple backticks with language identifier:

def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")

hello_world()

Links and Images

[Link text](https://example.com)
![Alt text](image.png)

Tables

| Header 1 | Header 2 |
|----------|----------|
| Cell 1   | Cell 2   |
| Cell 3   | Cell 4   |

Result:

Header 1 Header 2
Cell 1 Cell 2
Cell 3 Cell 4
